column1:
## Reason for admission
69-year-old man admitted on 2024-01-01 with shortness of breath that he got a couple of days after a stay in Spain.

## Medical history
Hypertension. Deep vein thrombosis bilaterally in Spain four months ago.

## Hospital course 
DT pulmonary arteries. Normal EF. MetHb 5.6. Hb 96. No signs of infection in lab. Hence hypoxia and anemia of unclear nature. Received oxygen. Hb initially falling from 96 to 83. Target saturation > 90%. It appears that the patient had fever and skin rash. Also weight loss of 10kg since October. Was informed about the diagnosis and treatment was started after consultation with the infection diseases doctor. In the neurological status we forund bradykinesia, positive Babinski's sign was found bilaterally. Also, fasciculations in the hands. Investigated with MRI of the brain and spine without signs of ALS or Parkinson's plus. EMG was performed and showed findings consistent with diffuse lower motor neuron involvement. LP with no anomalous findings so far. The patient saturates at 94% on room air and is discharged from the ward.

## Medications
- Omeprazole (Omeprazole) PO 20 Mg 1+0+0
- Eliquis (Apixaban) PO 5 Mg 1+0+1
- Betolvex (Cyanocobalamin) PO 1 Mg 1+0+0
- Requip Depot (Ropinirole) PO 4 Mg 2+0+0
- Mirtazapine (Mirtazapine) PO 15 Mg 0+0+1

## Plan after discharge
Follow-up at the neurology department.

## Diagnosis
- Hypertension
- DVT

## Main diagnosis (name and ICD code)
